intro: Psathura myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtleleaf psathura, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
